value.original: Defines the columns of a table

row.value: Defines the columns of a table

value.original: The Reference Tab defines the references that are used to validate data

row.value: The Reference Tab defines the references that are used to validate data

value.original: The Table Validation Tab defines tables to validate data

row.value: The Table Validation Tab defines tables to validate data

value.original: The List Validation Tab defines lists to validate data

row.value: The List Validation Tab defines lists to validate data

value.original: The Window Tab defines each window in the system. The default flag indicates that this window should be used as the default Zoom windows for the tables in this window.

row.value: The Window Tab defines each window in the system.

value.original: Tab definition within a window holds fields

row.value: Tab definition within a window holds fields

value.original: The Tab Tab defines each Tab within a Window. Each Tab contains a discrete selection of fields.

row.value: The Tab Tab defines each Tab within a Window. Each Tab contains a descrete selection of fields.

value.original: Field definitions in tabs in windows

row.value: Field definitions in tabs in windows

value.original: The Field Tab defines the Fields displayed within a tab. Changes made to the Field Tab become visible after restart due to caching

row.value: The Field Tab defines the Fields displayed within a tab. Changes made to the Field Tab become visible after restart due to caching

value.original: The Validation Rules Tab defines all dynamic rules used when entering and maintaining columns and fields.

row.value: The Validation Rules Tab defines all dynamic rules used when entering and maintaining columns and fields.

value.original: The Message Tab displays error message text and menu messages

row.value: The Message Tab displays error message text and menu messages

value.original: The Menu Tab defines the tree structured menu which will be used for the selected Organization.

row.value: The Menu Tab defines the tree structured menu which will be used for the selected Organization.

value.original: Menu Translation - May not need to be translated

row.value: Menu Translation - May not need to be translated

value.original: Menu translations are derived from Window, Process, etc. You only need to translate Summary level items.

row.value: Menu translations are derived from Window, Process, etc. You only need to translate Summaty level items.

value.original: If you want to add an additional User Interface language, select "System Language". Otherwise, the system allows you to just translate elements for printing documents.

row.value: If you want to add an additional User Interface language, select "System Language". Otherwise, the system allows you to just translate elements for printing documents.

value.original: Menu Translation - May not need to be translated

row.value: Menu Translation - May not need to be translated

value.original: Fields are automatically translated, if centrally maintained. You only need to translate not centrally maintained Fields.

row.value: Fields are automatically translated, if centrally maintained. You only need to translate not centrally maintained Fields.

value.original: The User Tab defines the log in for Users who have access to the system.

row.value: The User Tab defines the log in for Users who have access to the system.

value.original:
Define the role and add the client and organizations the role has access to. You can give users access to this role and modify the access of this role to windows, forms, processes and reports as well as tasks.
If the Role User Level is Manual, the assigned acces rights are not automatically updated (e.g. if a role has a restricted number of Windows/Processes it can access).

row.value: Define the role and add the client and organizations the role has access to. You can give users access to this role and modify the access of this role to windows, forms, processes and reports as well as tasks.

value.original: The User Assignment Tab displays Users who have been defined for this Role.

row.value: The User Assignment Tab displays Users who have been defined for this Role.

value.original: The User Roles Tab define the Roles each user may have. The Roles will determine what windows, tasks, processes and workflows that a User has access to.

row.value: The User Roles Tab define the Roles each user may have. The Roles will determine what windows, tasks, processes and workflows that a User has access to.

value.original: The Node Tab defines each Node or step in this Workflow.

row.value: The Node Tab defines each Node or step in this Workflow.

value.original: The Next Nodes Tab defines the order or Nodes or Steps in a Workflow.

row.value: The Next Nodes Tab defines the order or Nodes or Steps in a Workflow.

value.original: The Conversion Rate Tab defines the rates to use when converting a source currency to an accounting or reporting currency.

row.value: The Conversion Rate Tab defines the rates to use when converting a source currency to an accounting or reporting currency.

value.original: The Calendar Tab defines each calendar that will be used by an Organization.

row.value: The Calendar Tab defines each calendar that will be used by an Organization.

value.original: The Year Window is used to define each year for the specified calendar.

row.value: The Year Window is used to define each year for the specified calendar.

value.original: The Period Tab defines a Period No, Name and Start Date for each Calendar Year. Each period begins on the defined Start Date and ends one day prior to the next period's Start Date.

row.value: The Period Tab defines a Period No, Name and Start Date for each Calendar Year. Each period begins on the defined Start Date and ends one day prior to the next period's Start Date.

value.original: The Non Business Days Tab defines those days to exclude when calculating the due date for given payment terms. For example, if an invoice terms was Net 10 days and the Invoice Date was 2/17/2000 the due date would be 2/27/2000. If 2/27/2000 was defined as a non business day then the due date on the Invoice would be 2/28/2000.

row.value: The Non Business Days Tab defines those days to exclude when calculating the due date for given payment terms. For example, if an invoice terms was Net 10 days and the Invoice Date was 2/17/2000 the due date would be 2/27/2000. If 2/27/2000 was defined as a non busness day then the due date on the Invoice would be 2/28/2000.

value.original: The Element Value Tab defines the individual valid values for the Element. The values must conform to the format defined. If the Element is an Account Type then the Account Classification (Asset, Liability etc) and posting controls are also defined

row.value: The Element Value Tab defines the individual valid values for the Element. The values must conform to the format defined. If the Element is an Account Type then the Account Classification (Asset, Liability etc) and posting controls are also defined

value.original: The Unit of Measure Tab defines a non monetary Unit of Measure.

row.value: The Unit of Measure Tab defines a non monetary Unit of Measure.

value.original: Define standard Unit of Measure Conversion

row.value: Define standard Unit of Measure Conversion

value.original: The Conversion Tab defines the rates for converting a Unit of Measure. The system provides some automatic conversions between units of measures (e.g. minute, hour, day, working day, etc.) if they are not explicitly defined here. Conversions need to be direct (i.e. if you have only a conversion between A-B and B-C, the system cannot convert A-C, you need to define it explicitly).

row.value: The Conversion Tab defines the rates for converting a Unit of Measure. The system provides some automatic conversions between units of measures (e.g. minute, hour, day, working day, etc.) if they are not explicitly defined here. Conversions need to be direct (i.e. if you have only a conversion between A-B and B-C, the system cannot convert A-C, you need to define it explicitly).

value.original: The Country Tab defines any country in which you do business. Values entered here are referenced in location records for Business Partners.

row.value: The Country Tab defines any country in which you do business. Values entered here are referenced in location records for Business Partners.

value.original: The Region Tab defines a Region within a Country. This tab is enabled only if the Has Region checkbox is selected for the Country.

row.value: The Region Tab defines a Region within a Country. This tab is enabled only if the Has Region checkbox is selected for the Country.

value.original: When adding a new organization, you must re-login to be able to access the new organization!

The Organization Tab is used to define an Organization. Each Organization has a Key and Name and optionally a Description. When adding a new organization, you must re-login to be able to access the new organization.

row.value: The Organization Tab is used to define an Organization. Each Organization has a Key and Name and optionally a Description. When adding a new organization, you must re-login to be able to access the new organization.

value.original: Create a new client via "Initial Client Setup". You should only change information here.

The Client Definition Tab defines a unique client. Do not create a new client in this window, but use "Initial Client Setup" (System Administrator Role) to set up the required security and access rules. If you create a new client here, you will not be able to view it and also the required client infrastructure would not have been set up.

row.value: The Client Definition Tab defines a unique client. Do not create a new client in this window, but use "Initial Client Setup" to set up the required security and access rules. If you create a new client here, wou will not be able to view it and also the required client infrastructure would not have been set up.

value.original: The Sequence Tab defines the numeric sequencing to use for documents. These can also include a alpha suffix and / or prefix.

row.value: The Sequence Tab defines the numeric sequencing to use for documents. These can also include a alpha suffix and / or prefix.

value.original: The Workflow Tab defines Workflows in the system.

row.value: The Workflow Tab defines Workflows in the system.

value.original: The Task Tab defines the unique tasks that will be used.

row.value: The Task Tab defines the unique tasks that will be used.

value.original: The Currency Tab defines any currency you will transact with or report in.

row.value: The Currency Tab defines any currency you will transact with or report in.

value.original: The Element Tab defines the Name, Description and Format for an Element. Additionally, a Type of Account or User Defined is selected. Each Account Schema must have an Account Element type. The User Defined Elements are optional.

row.value: The Element Tab defines the Name, Description and Format for an Element. Additionaly, a Type of Account or User Defined is selected. Each Account Schema must have an Account Element type. The User Defined Elements are optional.

value.original: The Location Tab defines the location of an Organization.

row.value: The Location Tab defines the location of an Organization.

value.original: Maintain System Client Org and User Preferences

row.value: Maintain System Client Org and User Preferences

value.original: The Project Tab is used to define the Value, Name and Description for each project. It also is defines the tracks the amounts assigned to, committed to and used for this project. Note that when the project Type is changed, the Phases and Tasks are re-created.

row.value: The Project Tab is used to define the Value, Name and Description for each project. It also is defines the tracks the amounts assigned to, commited to and used for this project.

value.original: The GL Category Tab defines optional identifiers for a document or journal. Each Category may be used on a document, manual journal or import

row.value: The GL Category Tab defines optional identifiers for a document or journal. Each Category may be used on a document, manual journal or import

value.original: The GL Journal Batch Tab defines the control parameters for a Journal Batch. A Batch can consist of multiple Journals.

row.value: The GL Journal Batch Tab defines the control parameters for a Journal Batch. A Batch can consist of multiple Journals.

value.original: The GL Journal Tab defines the control parameters for a single GL Journal.

row.value: The GL Journal Tab defines the control parameters for a single GL Journal.

value.original: The GL Journal Line Tab defines the individual debit and credit transactions that comprise a journal.

row.value: The GL Journal Line Tab defines the individual debit and credit transactions that comprise a journal.

value.original: The Document Definition Tab defines the processing parameters and controls for the document.

row.value: The Document Definition Tab defines the processing parameters and controls for the document.

value.original: The Approval Tab defines the approval types to be used in documents.

row.value: The Approval Tab defines the approval types to be used in documents.

value.original: The Client Info Tab defines the details for each client. The accounting rules and high level defaults are defined here. The Calendar is used to determine if a period is open or closed.

row.value: The Client Info Tab defines the detailsfor each client. The accounting rules and high level defaults are defined here.

value.original: The Organization Info Tab is used to define an Organization's address, DUNS number and Tax Identification number

row.value: The Organization Info Tab is used to define an Organization's address, DUNS number and Tax Indentification number

value.original: The Attachment tab displays the attributes of an attachment.

row.value: The Attachment tab displays the attributes of an attachment.

value.original: The Tax Rate Window defines the different taxes used for each tax category. For example, Sales Tax must be defined for each State in which it applies. If you have multiple taxes, create a summary level tax with the approximate total tax rate and the actual tax rates pointing to the summary level tax as their parent. When entering the order or invoice lines, the tax is estimated, the correct tax is calculated when the document is processed. The tax is always calculated from the line net amount. If one tax has a the tax basis the line net amount and another tax, you need to adjust the percentage to result in the correct amount.

row.value: The Tax Rate Window defines the different taxes used for each tax category. For example, Sales Tax must be defined for each State in which it applies. If you have multiple taxes, create a summary level tax with the approximate total tax rate and the actual tax rates pointing to the summary level tax as their parent. When entering the order or invoice lines, the tax is estimated, the correct tax is calculated when the document is processed. The tax is always calculated from the line net amount. If one tax has has a the tax basis the line net amount and another tax, you need to adjust the percentage to result in the correct amount.

value.original: The Tax Category Tab is used to define and maintain Tax Categories. Each Product is associated with a Tax Category. This facilitates adapting to changes in taxation.

row.value: The Tax Category Tab is used to define and maintain Tax Categories. Each Product is associated with a Tax Category. This facilitates adapting to changes in taxation.

value.original: The Warehouse Tab defines each Warehouse that is used to store products.

row.value: The Warehouse Tab defines each Warehouse that is used to store products.

value.original: The Locator Tab defines any Locators for that Warehouse.

row.value: The Locator Tab defines any Locators for that Warehouse.

value.original: The Product Tab defines each product and identifies it for use in price lists and orders. The Location is the default location when receiving the stored product.

row.value: The Product Tab defines each product and identifies it for use in price lists and orders.

value.original: The Substitute Tab defines products which may be used as a replacement for the selected product.

row.value: The Substitute Tab defines products which may be used as a replacement for the selected product.

value.original: The Replenishment Tab defines the type of replenishment quantities. This is used for automated ordering.

row.value: The Replenishment Tab defines the type of replenishment quantities. This is used for automated ordering.

value.original: The Pricing Tab displays the List, Standard and Limit prices for each price list a product is contained in.

row.value: The Pricing Tab displays the List, Standard and Limit prices for each price list a product is contained in.

value.original: The Payment Term Tab defines the different payments terms that you offer to your Business Partners when paying invoices and also those terms which your Vendors offer you for payment of your invoices. On the standard invoice, the Name and the Document Note of the Payment Term is printed.

row.value: The Payment Term Tab defines the different payments terms that you offer to your Business Partners when paying invoices and also those terms which your Vendors offer you for payment of your invoices. On the standard invoice, the Name and the Document Note of the Payment Term is printed.

value.original: The Shippers Tab defines any entity who will provide shipping to or shipping from an Organization.

row.value: The Shippers Tab defines any entity who will provide shipping to or shipping from an Organization.

value.original: The Order Header Tab defines the parameters of an Order

row.value: The Order Header Tab defines the parameters of an Order

value.original: The Order Line Tab defines the individual line items that comprise an Order.

row.value: The Order Line Tab defines the individual line items that comprise an Order.

value.original: The Product Category defines unique groupings of products. Product categories can be used in building price lists.

row.value: The Product Category defines unique groupings of products. Product categories can be used in building price lists.

value.original: Price lists determine currency of the document as well as tax treatment.

row.value: Price lists determine currency of the document as well as tax treatment.

value.original: The Price List Tab displays the prices for a product based on the selected price list.

row.value: The Price List Tab displays the prices for a product based on the selected price list.

value.original: The Invoice Schedule Tab defines the frequency for which batch invoices will be generated for a Business Partner.

row.value: The Invoice Schedule Tab defines the frequency for which batch invoices will be generated for a Business Partner.

value.original: The Conversion Rates tab is used to define conversion rates to be used when converting document amounts from one currency to another. Conversion rates can be defined for multiple rate types. They can also be effective for a defined range of dates.

row.value: The Conversion Rates tab is used to define conversion rates to be used when converting document amounts from one currency to another. Conversion rates can be defined for mulitple rate types. They can also be effective for a defined range of dates.

value.original: For changes to become effective, you must re-login and re-start the Application Server.
The Accounting Schema Tab defines the controls used for accounting. Each Organization will select an Accounting Schema to use.

row.value: The Accounting Schema Tab defines the controls used for accounting. Each Organization will select an Accounting Schema to use.

value.original: For changes to become effective, you must re-login and re-start the Application Server.
The General Ledger Tab defines error and balance handling to use as well as the necessary accounts for posting to General Ledger.

row.value: The General Ledger Tab defines error and balance handling to use as well as the necessary accounts for posting to General Ledger.

value.original: The Marketing Campaign Tab defines the parameters for a Campaign. These include a start and end date as well as the amount of any invoices that have been processed which reference this campaign.

row.value: The Marketing Campaign Tab defines the parameters for a Campaign. These include a start and end date as well as the amount of any invoices that have been processed which reference this campaign.

value.original: The Marketing Channel Tab defines the different methods or processes through which customers are obtained.

row.value: The Marketing Channel Tab defines the different methods or processes through which customers are obtained.

value.original: The Element Tab defines each system level element.

row.value: The Element Tab defines each system level element.

value.original: The Period Control Tab displays the status of a Period (Never Opened, Opened, Closed).

row.value: The Period Control Tab displays the status of a Period (Never Opened, Opened, Closed).

value.original: The Sales Region Tab defines the different regions where you do business. Sales Regions can be used when generating reports or calculating commissions.

row.value: The Sales Region Tab defines the different regions where you do business. Sales Regions can be used when generating reports or calculating commissions.

value.original: The Account Combination Tab defines and displays valid account combination. An Alias can be defined to facilitate document entry.

row.value: The Account Combination Tab defines and displays valid account combination. An Alias can be defined to facilitate document entry.

value.original: The GL Budget Tab defines a General Ledger Budget

row.value: The GL Budget Tab defines a General Ledger Budget

value.original: The GL Budgets are used to define the anticipated costs of doing business. They are used in reporting as a comparison to actual amounts.

row.value: The GL Budgets are used to define the anticipated costs of doing business. They are used in reporting as a comparison to actual amounts.

value.original: The Accounting Tab defines the Accounting parameters to be used for inventory in that Warehouse.

row.value: The Accounting Tab defines the Accounting parameters to be used for inventory in that Warehouse.

value.original: The Accounting Tab defines the defaults to use when generating accounting transactions for orders and invoices which contain this product.

row.value: The Accounting Tab defines the defaults to use when generating accounting transactions for orders and invoices which contain this product.

value.original: The Accounting Tab is used to define the Asset Account to use when a project is completed and the associated asset realized.

row.value: The Accounting Tab is used to define the Asset Account to use when a project is completed and the associated asset realized.

value.original: The Customer Accounting Tab defines the default accounts to use when this business partner is referenced on an accounts receivable transaction.

row.value: The Customer Accounting Tab defines the default accounts to use when this business partner is referenced on an accounts receivable transaction.

value.original: The Vendor Accounting Tab defines the default accounts to use when this business partner is referenced in an accounts payable transaction.

row.value: The Vendor Accounting Tab defines the default accounts to use when this business partner is referenced in an accounts payable transaction.

value.original: The Employee Accounting Tab defines the default accounts to use when this business partner is referenced on a expense reimbursement.

row.value: The Employee Accounting Tab defines the default accounts to use when this business partner is referenced on a expense reimbursement.

value.original: The Cities Tab defines Cities within a Country or Region. Cities entered here are not referenced when entering the address.

row.value: The Cities Tab defines Cities within a Country or Region.

value.original: ATTENTION: ANY CHANGES here will effect the structure of your chart of accounts! For changes to become effective, you must re-login and re-start the Application Server.
Define the elements of your Account Key

row.value: Define the elements of your Account Key

value.original: The Account Schema Element Tab defines the elements that comprise the account key. A name is defined which will display in documents. Also the order of the elements and if they are balanced and mandatory are indicated.

row.value: The Account Schema Element Tab defines the elements that comprise the account key. A name is defined which will display in documents. Also the order of the elements and if they are balanced and mandatory are indicated.

value.original: The Business Partner Tab defines any Entity with whom an organization transacts.

row.value: The Business Partner Tab defines any Entity with whom an organization transacts.

value.original: The Location Tab defines the physical location of a business partner. A business partner may have multiple location records.

row.value: The Location Tab defines the physical location of a business partner. A business partner may have multiple location records.

value.original: The Customer Tab defines a Business Partner who is a customer of this organization. If the Customer check box is selected then the necessary fields will display.

row.value: The Customer Tab defines a Business Partner who is a customer of this organization. If the Customer check box is selected then the necessary fields will display.

value.original: The Vendor Tab defines a Business Partner that is a Vendor for this Organization. If the Vendor check box is selected the necessary fields will display.

row.value: The Vendor Tab defines a Business Partner that is a Vendor for this Organization. If the Vendor check box is selected the necessary fields will display.

value.original: The Employee Tab defines a Business Partner who is an Employee of this organization. If the Employee is also a Sales Representative then the check box should be selected.

row.value: The Employee Tab defines a Business Partner who is an Employee of this organization. If the Employee is also a Sales Representative then the check box should be selected.

value.original: The Define Bank Account Tab defines the banking information for this business partner. This data is used for processing payments and remittances.

row.value: The Define Bank Account Tab defines the banking information for this business partner. This data is used for processing payments and remittances.

value.original: The Bank Tab defines a bank that is used by an organization or business partner. Each Bank is given an identifying Name, Address, Routing No and Swift Code

row.value: The Bank Tab defines a bank that is used by an organization or business partner. Each Bank is given an identifying Name, Address, Routing No and Swift Code

value.original: The Account Tab is used to define one or more accounts for a Bank. Each account has a unique Account No and Currency.

row.value: The Account Tab is used to define one or more accounts for a Bank. Each account has a unique Account No and Currency.

value.original: The Withholding Tab defines any withholding information for this business partner.

row.value: The Withholding Tab defines any withholding information for this business partner.

value.original: The Translation Tab defines a Document Type in an alternate language.

row.value: The Translation Tab defines a Document Type in an alternate language.

value.original: The Dunning Tab defines the parameters for a dunning level.

row.value: The Dunning Tab defines the parameters for a dunning level.

value.original: The Translation Tab defines the translation to an alternate language

row.value: The Translation Tab defines the translation to an alternate language

value.original: The Order Tax Tab displays the tax amount for an Order based on the lines entered.

row.value: The Order Tax Tab displays the tax amount for an Order based on the lines entered.

value.original: The Charge Tab defines the unique charges that may be associated with a document.

row.value: The Charge Tab defines the unique charges that may be associated with a document.

value.original: Price lists are automatically created based on Product Purchasing Information and the Vendor Category Discount. The other alternative is to copy them from existing pricelists and the re-calculate them. You can also re-calculate the pricelist by referencing no pricelist or referencing the same pricelist. If no base price list is selected, the Procuct Purchase records are used as reference.

row.value: Price lists are automatically created based on Product Purchasing Information and the Vendor Category Discount. The other alternative is to copy them from existing pricelists and the re-calculate them. You can also re-calculate the pricelist by referencing no pricelist or referencing the same pricelist.

value.original: The Purchasing Tab define the pricing and rules ( pack quantity, UPC, minimum order quantity) for each product.

row.value: The Purchasing Tab define the pricing and rules ( pack quantity, UPC, minimum order quantity) for each product.

value.original: The Withholding Rules Tab define the rules governing the withholding of amounts.

row.value: The Withholding Rules Tab define the rules governing the withholding of amounts.

value.original: The Tree Tab defines a Tree which will be displayed.

row.value: The Tree Tab defines a Tree which will be displayed.

value.original: The Report and Process Tab defines each report and process run in the system.

row.value: The Report and Process Tab defines each report and process run in the system.

value.original: The Report Parameter Tab defines any parameters required to execute a report or process.

row.value: The Report Parameter Tab defines any parameters requried to execute a report or process.

value.original: The Defaults Tab displays the Default accounts for an Accounting Schema. These values will display when a new document is opened. The user can override these defaults within the document.

row.value: The Defaults Tab displays the Default accounts for an Accounting Schema. These values will display when a new document is opened. The user can override these defaults within the document.

value.original: The Inventory Count Tab defines the parameters for a manual count and adjustment of inventory. When creating the inventory count list automatically, only the actual stored products are included. The exception is when you select the equals 0 (=0) option, then zero on hand records of all stocked products is created for that location.

row.value: The Inventory Count Tab defines the parameters for a manual count and adjustment of inventory

value.original: The Inventory Count Line defines the counts of the individual products in inventory.

row.value: The Inventory Count Line defines the counts of the individual products in inventory.

value.original: The Shipments Tab allows you to generate, maintain, enter and process Shipments to a Customer or Returns from a Customer.

row.value: The Shipments Tab allows you to generate, maintain, enter and process Shipments to a Customer or Returns from a Customer.

value.original: The Shipment Line Tab defines the individual items in a Shipment.

row.value: The Shipment Line Tab defines the individual items in a Shipment.

value.original: The Move Tab defines and identifies the movement of an item or items in inventory.

row.value: The Move Tab defines and identifies the movement of an item or items in inventory.

value.original: The Move Line Tab defines the product and quantity to be moved and the location it is moving from and to.

row.value: The Move Line Tab defines the product and quantity to be moved and the location it is moving from and to.

value.original: The Invoice Tab defines the parameters of an Invoice generated for a Business Partner. It constitutes an accounts receivable.

row.value: The Invoice Tab defines the parameters of an Invoice generated for a Business Partner. It constitutes an accounts receivable.

value.original: The Dunning Level Tab defines the timing and frequency of the dunning notices.

row.value: The Dunning Level Tab defines the timing and frequency of the dunning notices.

value.original: The Invoice Line Tab defines the individual items or charges on an Invoice.

row.value: The Invoice Line Tab defines the individual items or charges on an Invoice.

value.original: The Invoice Tax Tab displays the total tax due based on the Invoice Lines.

row.value: The Invoice Tax Tab displays the total tax due based on the Invoice Lines.

value.original: The Revenue Recognition Tab defines the intervals at which revenue will be recognized. You can also base the revenue recognition on provided Service Levels.

row.value: The Revenue Recognition Tab defines the intervals at which revenue will be recognized. You can also base the revenue recognition on provided Service Levels.

value.original: The Vendor Tab displays the Vendors. A Vendor is selected and all products for that Vendor will be displayed.

row.value: The Vendor Tab displays the Vendors. A Vendor is selected and all products for that Vendor will be displayed.

value.original: The Product Details Tab allows you to display and maintain all products for a selected Vendor.

row.value: The Product Details Tab allows you to display and maintain all products for a selected Vendor.

value.original: The Greeting Tab defines the manner in which you will address business partners on documents.

row.value: The Greeting Tab defines the manner in which you will address business partners on documents.

value.original: The Define Report View defines the views used in report generation

row.value: The Define Report View defines the views used in report generation

value.original: The Transaction Tab displays the transactions that have been processed for this product.

row.value: The Transaction Tab displays the transactions that have been processed for this product.

value.original: The Invoice Tab defines the parameters of an Invoice generated by a Business Partner. It constitutes an accounts payable.

row.value: The Invoice Tab defines the parameters of an Invoice generated by a Business Partner. It constitutes an accounts payable.

value.original: The Invoice Line Tab defines the individual items or charges on an Invoice.

row.value: The Invoice Line Tab defines the individual items or charges on an Invoice.

value.original: The Invoice Tax Tab displays the total tax due based on the Invoice Lines.

row.value: The Invoice Tax Tab displays the total tax due based on the Invoice Lines.

value.original: The Order Line Tab defines the individual items in an order.

row.value: The Order Line Tab defines the individual items in an order.

value.original: The Order Header Tab defines the parameters of an order. The field values defined will determine how the Order Lines are processed.

row.value: The Order Header Tab defines the parameters of an order. The field values defined will determine how the Order Lines are processed.

value.original: The Order Tax Tab displays the tax associated with the Order Lines.

row.value: The Order Tax Tab displays the tax associated with the Order Lines.

value.original: The Shipments Tab allows you to generate, maintain, enter and process Shipments from a Vendor or Returns to a Vendor.

row.value: The Shipments Tab allows you to generate, maintain, enter and process Shipments from a Vendor or Returns to a Vendor.

value.original: The Shipment Line Tab defines the individual items in a Shipment.

row.value: The Shipment Line Tab defines the individual items in a Shipment.

value.original: The Forms Tab defines any window which is not automatically generated. For System Admin use only.

row.value: The Forms Tab defines any window which is not automatically generated. For System Admin use only.

value.original: The Window Access Tab defines the Windows and type of access that this Role is granted.

row.value: The Window Access Tab defines the Windows and type of access that this Role is granted.

value.original: The Process Access Tab defines the Processes and type of access that this Role is granted.

row.value: The Process Access Tab defines the Processes and type of access that this Role is granted.

value.original: The Form Access Tab defines the Forms and type of access that this Role is granted.

row.value: The Form Access Tab defines the Forms and type of access that this Role is granted.

value.original: The Workflow Access Tab defines the Workflows and type of access that this Role is granted.

value.original: The Report Access Tab determines who can access a report or process

value.original:
Define the individual field based on the table definition. Please note that you have to make sure that a Constant has the correct SQL data type (i.e. if it is a 'string', you need to enclose it like 'this').

Product mapping (for details see documentation): 

H_Item => Value
H_ItemDesc => Name / Description
H_ItemDefn => Help
H_ItemType => ProductCategory
H_PartnrID => Value of Business Partner
H_Commodity1 => Vendor Product No
H_Commodity2 => SKU
H_ItemClass => Classification (A,B,C..)
V_OperAmt_T_Cur => Currency
V_OperAmt_T => Price

row.value:
Define the individual field based on the table definition. Please note that you have to make sure that a Costant has the correct SQL datatype (i.e. if it is a 'string', you need to enclose it like 'this').

Product mapping (for details see documentation): 

H_Item => Value
H_ItemDesc => Name / Description
H_ItemDefn => Help
H_ItemType => ProductCategory
H_PartnrID => Value of Business Partner
H_Commodity1 => Vendor Product No
H_Commodity2 => SKU
H_ItemClass => Classification (A,B,C..)
V_OperAmt_T_Cur => Currency
V_OperAmt_T => Price

value.original:
The Bill of Materials tab defines those products that are generated from other products. A Bill of Material (BOM) is one or more Products or BOMs.
Available Quantity: - Stored BOMs have to be created via "Production" - The available quantity of a non-stored BOMs is dynamically calculated - The attribute "Stored" is defined in the "Product" tab
Price: - BOMs must be listed in Pricelists - If the price is 0.00, the price is dynamically calculated
Printing: - Usually, only the BOM information is printed - For invoices, delivery slips and pick lists, you have the option to print the details - In the details, the quantity is listed - and the price, if this is dynamically calculated

row.value:
The Bill of Materials tab defines those products that are generated from other products. A Bill of Material (BOM) is one or more Products or BOMs.
Available Quantity: - Stored BOMs have to be created via "Production" - The available quantity of a non-stored BOMs is dynamically calculated - The attribute "Stored" is defined in the "Product" tab
Price: - BOMs must be listed in Pricelists - If the price is 0.00, the price is dynamically calculated
Printing: - Usually, only the BOM information is printed - For invoices, delivery slips and pick lists, you have the option to print the details - In the details, the quantity is listed - and the price, if this is dynamically calculated

value.original: The Electronic Payments Tab is used to define the parameters for the processing of electronic payments. If no currency is defined, all currencies are accepted. If a minumum amount is defined (or not zero), the payment processor is only used if the payment amount is equal or higher than the minumum amount.

value.original: The Statement Line Tab defines the individual line items on the Bank Statement. They can be entered manually or generated from payments entered.

value.original:
The Payment Tab defines a payment made by a Business Partner. If it is for a single invoice it can be allocated directly to that invoice using this screen. You can also apply over/under payments:
You have an over-payment, if you received more money than due for a single invoice. Instead of writing the difference off (i.e. would be a gain), you can leave the amount unallocated and use it for later invoices or credit memos. Please note that the Amount is the payment amount, so you need to enter the over-payment as a negative amount.
You can also receive a partial payment (under-payment). If you decide not to write off the remaining invoice amount, enter the under-payment as a positive amount.

row.value:
The Payment Tab defines a payment made by a Business Partner. If it is for a single invoice it can be allocated directly to that invoice using this screen. You can also apply over/under payments:
You have an over-payment, if you received more money than due for a single invoice. Instead of writing the difference off (i.e. would be a gain), you can leave the amount unallocated and use it for later invoices or credit memos. Please note that the Amount is the payment amount, so you need to enter the over-payment as a negative amount.
You can also receive a parcial payment (under-payment). If you decide not to write off the remaining invoice amount, enter the under-payment as a postive amount.

value.original: Define when to pay a commission to whom. For each period, you start the calculation of the commission after the transaction for that period are completed or closed.

row.value: Define when to pay a commission to whom. For each period, you start the calculation of the commission after the transcation for that period are completed or cloased.

value.original:
Define the selection criteria for paying the commission. If you do not enter restricting parameters (e.g. for specific Business Partner (Groups) or Product (Categories), etc. all transactions for the period will be used to calculate the commission.
After converting from the transaction to the commission currency, the formula for calculating the commission is:
(Converted Amount - Subtract Amount) * Amount Multiplier + (Actual Quantity - Subtract Quantity) * Quantity Multiplier
You can choose, that only positive amounts (Converted Amount - Subtract Amount) and positive quantities (Actual Quantity - Subtract Quantity) are used in the calculation.

row.value:
Define the selection criteria for paying the commission. If you do not enter restricting parameters (e.g. for specific Business Partner (Groups) or Product (Categories), etc. all transactions for the period will be used to calculate the commission.
After converting from the transaction to the commission currency, the formula for calculating the commission is:
(Converted Amount - Subtract Amount) * Amount Multiplier + (Actual Quantity - Subtract Quantity) * Quantity Multiplier
You can choose, that only positive amounts (Converted Amount - Subtract Amount) and positive quantities (Actual Quantity - Subtract Quantity) are used in the calculation.

value.original: The Performance Measure Calculation defines how performance measures will be calculated. Please test the statement in SQL*Plus first. The select statement needs to return a single value! Any restrictions for Date range, Organizations, Business Partners, Products should be done via the "Performance Measure" window. This is the generic calculation. As this tends to be somewhat technical, the system has a few examples predefined.

row.value: The Performance Measure Calculation defines how performance measures will be calculated. Please test the statement in SQL*Plus first. The select statement needs to return a single value! Any restrictions for Date range, Organizations, Business Partners, Products should be done via the "Performance Measure" window. This is the generic calculation. As this tends to be somewhat technical, the system has a few examples predefined.

value.original: Trade discount schema calculates the trade discount percentage

value.original:
Pricelists are created based on Product Purchase and Category Discounts. The parameters listed here allow to copy and calculate pricelists.
The calculation:
  • Copy and convert price from referenced price list
  • result plus Surcharge Amount
  • result minus Discount
  • if resulting price is less than the original limit price plus min Margin, use this price (only if Margin is not zero)
  • if resulting price is more than the original limit price plus max Margin, use this price (only if Margin us not zero)
  • Round resulting price
The Formula is
NewPrice = (Convert(BasePrice) + Surcharge) * (100-Discount) / 100;
if MinMargin <> 0 then NewPrice = Max (NewPrice, Convert(OrigLimitPrice) + MinMargin);
if MaxMargin <> 0 then NewPrice = Min (NewPrice, Convert(OrigLimitPrice) + MaxMargin);

Example: (assuming same currency)
Original Prices: List=300, Standard=250, Limit=200;
New List Price: Base=List, Surcharge=0, Discount=0, Round

row.value:
Pricelists are created based on Product Purchase and Category Discounts. The parameters listed here allow to copy and calculate pricelists.
The calculation:
  • Copy and convert price from referenced price list
  • result plus Surcharge Amount
  • result minus Discount
  • if resulting price is less than the original limit price plus min Margin, use this price (only if Margin is not zero)
  • if resulting price is more than the original limit price plus max Margin, use this price (only if Margin us not zero)
  • Round resulting price
The Formula is
NewPrice = (Convert(BasePrice) + Surcharge) * (100-Discount) / 100;
if MinMargin <> 0 then NewPrice = Max (NewPrice, Convert(OrigLimitPrice) + MinMargin);
if MaxMargin <> 0 then NewPrice = Min (NewPrice, Convert(OrigLimitPrice) + MaxMargin);

Example: (assuming same currency)
Original Prices: List=300, Standard=250, Limit=200;
New List Price: Base=List, Surcharge=0, Discount=0, Round

value.original:
Enter the time and expenses for the Employee or Contractor (Business Partner).
The price list determines the default costs of the expenses, products or resource to be reimbursed. In that sense, it is a "Purchase Price" list. The Warehouse is used to correct the inventory of items invoiced to customers (i.e. if not invoiced, the inventory is not adjusted).
Please note that the Business Partner must be an Employee with an Address and Contact!

Enter the expense items and billable or non-billable hours. If you enter a non-zero amount in Invoiced Amount, that amount will be used for billing the customer - otherwise the price on the current sales price list of the customer.
Dates, when the resource is not available (e.g. vacation)

row.value: Dates, when rhe resource is not available (e.g. vacation)

value.original:
The Print Table Format lets you define how table header, etc. is printed. If you leave the entries empty, the default colors and fonts are used:
Fonts are based on the Font used in the Report; Page Header and Table Header will be bold, the Function Font is Bold-Italic, the Footer Font is two points smaller, the Parameter Font is Italic.

The Print Table Format lets you define how table header, etc. is printed. If you leave the entries empty, the default colors and fonts are used:

value.original:
Before importing, Adempiere checks the Unit of Measure (default if not set), the Product Category (default if not set), the Business Partner, the Currency (defaults to accounting currency if not set), the Product Type (only Items and Services), the uniqueness of UPC, Key and uniqueness and existence of the Vendor Product No.
Adempiere tries to map to existing products, if the UPC, the Key and the Vendor Product No matches (in this sequence). If the imported record could be matched, product field values will only be overwritten, if the corresponding Import field is explicitly defined. Example: the Product Category will only be overwritten if explicitly set in the Import.

row.value:
Before importing, Adempiere checks the Unit of Measure (default if not set), the Product Category (default if not set), the Business Partner, the Currency (defaults to accounting currency if not set), the Product Type (only Items and Services), the uniqueness of UPC, Key and uniqueness and existance of the Vendor Product No.
Adempiere tries to map to existing products, if the UPC, the Key and the Vendor Product No matches (in this sequence). If the imported record could be matched, product field values will only be overwritten, if the corresponding Import field is explicitly defined. Example: the Product Category will only be overwritten if explicitly set in the Import.

value.original: Attributes are specific to a Product Attribute Set (e.g. Size for T-Shirts: S,M,L). If you have multiple attributes and want to search under a common sttribute, you define a search sttribute. Example: have one Size search attribute combining the values of all different sizes (Size for Dress Shirt XL,L,M,S,XS). The Attribute Search allows you to have all values available for selection. This eases the maintenance of the individual product attribute.

row.value: Attributes are specific to a Product Attribute Set (e.g. Size for T-Shirts: S,M,L). If you have multiple attributes and want to search under a common sttribute, you define a search sttribute. Example: have one Size search attribute combining the values of all different sizes (Size for Dress Shirt XL,L,M,S,XS). The Attribute Search allows you to have all values available for selection. This eases the maintenance of the individual product attribute.

value.original: Maintain Recurring Documents. The Date Next Run determines the Document (and Accounting Date) of the generated documents.

Validate and Import Inventory Transactions. The Locator is primarily determined by the Locator Key, then the Warehouse and X,Y,Z fields.

A Physical Inventory is created per Warehouse and Movement Date.

value.original:
A new Journal Batch is created, if the Batch Document No is different. A new Journal is created, if the Document No, Accounting Schema, Currency, Document Type, GL Category, Posting Type or Accounting type is different.

Please note that there are three Organization Fields: The Document Organization is the owner of the document and set directly or per parameter default. The Organization is part of the accounting key and only required id no Valid Account Comination is specified; If not defined it is derived from the Document Organization. The Transaction Organization is part of the account combination.

You should supply the Document Type Name (or ID). The Document Type is on purpose not fully derived as it has too many consequences if it's wrong. The best way is to set the Document Type Name as a Constant in your Import File Format or as an imported field in the file.

You should supply the Document Type Name (or ID). The Document Type is on purpose not fully derived as it has too many consequences if it's wrong. The best way is to set the Document Type Name as a Constant in your Import File Format or as an imported field in the file.
